channel.title: Fixing update command

item.title: Fixing update command
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Yeah, seriously lmfao.

[quote=“Xile Maizez, post:6, topic:248964”][code][code] @WRX Ouch man, you must have missed the:

&& command.length() > 7)

On the first line, after, if (command.startsWith("update")

As for the update command, I think i might have it, but try b b0yz 4’s code.[/code][/code][/quote]

No.

item.title: Fixing update command
item.dc:creator: @WRX WRX`
item.description:
@WRX wrote:

You just gave him the exact same comman, rofl.

@LKCTheReturn : You have an error with your commands somewhere else, not an error, but it is ruining the commands, try the other commands, like xteleto or tele, they probably don’t work either. If not, it is definitely the problem i encountered a while back.

Read full topic

item.title: Fixing update command
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

mine works idk what the prob is with yours try using this:

if (command.startsWith("update") && command.length() > 7) { PlayerHandler.updateSeconds = (Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7)) + 1); PlayerHandler.updateAnnounced = false; PlayerHandler.updateRunning = true; PlayerHandler.updateStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis(); }

Read full topic

item.title: Fixing update command
item.dc:creator: @LKCTheReturn LKCTheReturn
item.description:
@LKCTheReturn wrote:

for some reason my update command does not say there will be an update in like 30 seconds when i type ::update 30
could someone help me fix it?

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("update")) {
	PlayerHandler.updateSeconds = (Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7)) + 1);
	PlayerHandler.updateAnnounced = true;
	PlayerHandler.updateRunning = true;
	PlayerHandler.updateStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis(); }

Read full topic
